intro: Pfaffia tayronensis, commonly known as the yellow paracress, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a short stature, typically growing to about 30 centimeters in height. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
